file_content.text: Go on. It's alright. I'll be alright here....
He can't get to us here. We'll be safe....
Well, that was exciting. I'm disappointed I didn't get to fry you, but I can settle for your asphyxiation.
Enjoy being buried alive, my friends. Enjoy.
He's wrong. He's wrong! First, though... first....
Here. This is a cache. The Czerka files I hid years ago... I buried them all over the desert, and this is the first batch. You can have them.
What made you decide to hand this over?
Why give these to me?
I want you to hurt Czerka! All those years keeping their secrets... and then they try to kill me.
I didn't mean to involve you with Czerka again.
I'm sorry about all this.
You heard the hologram. Czerka is trying to kill me now.
I don't owe them anything. And my friends from the base... they can't be hurt.
It's about time I got something useful out of this mess.
Hand them over.
Huh. I may not like you, but I like that Czerka man even less. Maybe this... maybe these will hurt him.
Now--I had an escape planned when I built this place. There's a back entrance to take you outside.
Grommik, you're a lifesaver.
That's great news!
You can't just stay here.
What about you?
Your help isn't needed.
Huh. Maybe I shouldn't have taken you here at all.
Go on. I need to rest awhile. I need to wait until they stop watching my farm.
If you want the other files on Czerka... you'll find them in the desert. Just don't let them get away with this.
We can't wait here! He'll kill us all if we don't move!
The console! It says you fixed everything. You really fixed it!
Back before--I could've done it myself. Not so much anymore.
It's nothing to be ashamed of. It's dangerous out there.
Don't be hard on yourself.
There is no emotion--there is peace. Remember that.
Don't worry--it's okay.
I don't even know what that means.
Even old soldiers are allowed to retire.
Don't be hard on yourself.
Trust me, a little caution is never a bad thing.
Don't be hard on yourself.
You're a good one. You should be proud. It's good, honest work, fixing farms.
You must've been pretty tough back then.
Tell me about the old days.
You really are a cowardly old man.
Pathetic.
I'm not a coward. Never was.
You know, I used to be a security guard for Czerka. But they've been gone for years, now.
They've left me alone, and I've stayed by myself.
Czerka's involved in something that threatens Republic security. I need some answers.
This is Republic business.
The Republic? I... all right.
What exactly were your duties at Czerka?
You were a security guard....
Now we're getting somewhere. I want to know more.
Finally, progress.
The scientists' project--it was all secret. Czerka never told us what was in that cave.
When it all went wrong... I had to lock up the base. Leave the others behind. I left the desert and the horrors and went to Anchorhead.
What horrors? What happened to the facility?
Wait--what about the base?
Something attacked us from inside... I don't remember.
That explains how you survived when no one else did.
You were the last man out.
You're completely delusional, aren't you?
Useless old man.
I'm not deluded. I saw things in that base!
When I realized I was alone, I didn't want to go back to Czerka. I wanted to forget.
So I cleaned it all up. I took the data and hid it. Buried it in the sand.
I think that's enough from the old man, don't you?
You're Czerka! I recognize your uniform!
Pity the suns dulled his brain, but then, I suspect he was never too bright. Yes, Grommik, I'm with Czerka.
How'd you track us down?
You found me?
Still unwilling to come in person?
Coward!
Sometimes a little distance can be important to a relationship.
A pleasure to see you again, Leksende.
Hello.
And you! I'm overjoyed to see your smiling face.
You're lucky I can't trace your comm signal.
I'd shoot you if I could.
Believe me, it wouldn't do you any good.
If it isn't my old buddy, the corporate stooge.
Hey, Leksende!
You have a pet name for me? How sweet!
I guess we both agree that Grommik's past his prime.
The old man's useless.
Marvelous! We have common ground, then.
Czerka found out about Grommik a while ago. We disabled his perimeter sensors and waited to see if anyone would come.
You broke my moisture vaporators!
Those too, yes. May I continue?
Our honey pot seems to have caught a few flies, and now I'm free to murder you and the old man together.
Let's talk this through, Leksende.
Peace is still an option.
I'll beat you.
You could try to kill us--or we could join forces.
Let's cut a deal.
An interesting offer, but I have things well in hand.
I'm speaking to you from an airship two kilometers above ground. I can target you with turbolasers and drop droids on your little heads.
The advantage is mine.
We have to get to shelter. Follow me!
Be careful out there when you're fixing things. The Sand People... they kill in the shadows.
Twenty more minutes until I'm leaving. Then the doors are closing, Wallner. I love you like a brother, but the doors have to close... huh.
You. You weren't here before. You came all the way out to my farm? To fix my machines?
Are you Grommik Kurthson?
Grommik?
Mm-hm. I'm Grommik.
I'm here about Czerka. Your old employer.
I need information.
Czerka? No, my corporate credit is expired. It's just me now.
Senile? Great.
Nasty little rat. I lived in Anchorhead for a while. I know you don't get away with disrespect there.
I started to think you wouldn't come. Most shops think it's too dangerous out here.
But the Sand People--they keep bashing my vaporators. Lizards chew up my guns and alarms... this place used to be a fortress, but I just can't fix things anymore.
Talk to me. Is it just failing equipment, or is trouble coming?
Are you in danger?
I don't know. I can't figure out why it's breaking, and my rifle misses, and the creatures get closer every day....
You can fix my home, though. Didn't I send the credits to Anchorhead? That's why you're here.
Grommik, focus. Tell me about the Czerka base.
I want to know about Czerka.
Czerka was good, but I bought my equipment from AgriCorp and Balmorran Arms. Better for a farm.
You'll fix it up, won't you? I sent the credits... I need those repairs to protect me!
Never mind your farming equipment.
I'm not some repairman!
But someone needs to fix it! This is my farm, and it... it... I already sent the credits.
Let's say I am here to repair your farm. Why don't you explain what you need?
Okay. I'll help you.
It's the vaporators, and the perimeter sensors and the emergency guns. They need fixing. I think it was the Sand People.
I have the parts, it's just--I'm scared to leave my home without the sensors working.
It's shameful. I know....
Tell me about Czerka, or this turns ugly.
Don't make me mad. [Hit him]
You're threatening me? I used to be--I used to be a security man.
Ah! All right, blast you. I don't care. It was a long time ago.
I was--I was a security officer at Czerka Secret Weapons Division 7. I was so proud.
Any idea what Czerka was working on?
What did they do there?
How could you be proud of protecting illegal weapons research?
You were working for killers!
I was proud of being important. I didn't--I didn't know it was illegal. They didn't tell us that.
You're doing fine so far. Just don't test my patience.
Keep going or I get angry.
Ah, it's going to be a long day today. Long....
